pullRequest.title: [BEAM-8790] InfluxDB deployment
pullRequest.bodyText:
First PR that starts an implementation of the proposal: https://s.apache.org/test-metrics-storage-corrected
Instructions on how to deploy InfluxDB to Kubernetes cluster are available in the wiki: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/BEAM/Test+Results+Monitoring
After this PR is accepted and InfluxDB is deployed, next steps are:

Create new Grafana dashboards: BEAM-8134
Reporting test results to InfluxDB: BEAM-8132 and BEAM-8133


Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: [BEAM-8790] Local deployment of InfluxDB with docker-compose.yml

nodes.bodyText: Minor: should we use "user_metrics_db" and "perftests_metrics_db" instead?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -44,11 +62,16 @@ services:
       - GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD=<GrafanaPasswordHere>
       - GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ENABLED=true
       - GF_AUTH_ANONYMOUS_ORG_NAME=Beam
-      - DB_HOST=beampostgresql
-      - DB_PORT=5432
-      - DB_DBNAME=beam_metrics
-      - DB_DBUSERNAME=admin
-      - DB_DBPWD=<PGPasswordHere>
+      - PSQL_DB_HOST=beampostgresql
